string.text: Closed captions
On sound effects
Closed captions
No subtitles
Important subtitles only
All subtitles
Sending Message
Memo
[sender unknown]
<!DATA_ERROR!>
=?Network failure
Joker
Soldier
General
USS Command
[emission begins]
[bloodsucker roars]
[electric box opens]
[power switch clicks]
[elevator door opens]
[Grouse drops into elevator]
[door unlocks]
[bloodsucker roars]
[odd crackling noise from somewhere close]
[airlock decon system active]
[spatial bubble rumbles]
[spatial bubble bursts open]
[power generator starts]
[underpass gate opens]
[underpass elevator powers down]
[bomb countdown beeps]
[knocking on metal]
[door opens]
[door closes]
[door slams shut]
[metal door opens]
[switch clicks]
[radio call]
[wooden door opens]
[wooden door closes]
[steam hiss]
[pistol shot]
[guitar music]
[harmonica music]
[laughter]
[wounded bandit asks for help]
[wounded Dutyer asks for help]
[wounded Freedomer asks for help]
[wounded merc asks for help]
[wounded soldier asks for help]
[wounded Monolithian asks for help]
[wounded stalker asks for help]
[bandit attack]
[Duty attack]
[Freedom attack]
[mercenary attack]
[army attack]
[Monolith attack]
[stalker attack]
Attention stalkers, Skadovsk is under attack! We've been forced to batten down the hatches until things quiet down.
Come on, man, put that shooter away. This is our camp, you don't need it here.
Hey, man, this here place is as peaceful as it gets. So holster that shooter of yours and keep it that way.
Look it, weapons are for killing mutants and you won't find any in here. So, put it away now, would you?
Attention stalkers, the doors of Skadovsk are open to you once more.
Great! Here's the cash.
Stalkers, the emission is finally over. I hope you're all in one piece.
Drop in if something interesting comes up. Skadovsk won't be going anywhere, that's for sure...
Drop in if you find any artefacts, and we'll see what we can do.
Are we done here? ... Yes? Good... The exit is over there.
Yeah, yeah... You go on now. Dealing with leeches is not high on my list of priorities.
Hello! What brings you to our humble vessel?
Welcome aboard our swamp, icebreaker!
The ship has been ashore a long time, but it's still full of rats. To what do we owe this dubious pleasure?
What do you want?
Attention stalkers! An emission is approaching! I repeat, an emission is approaching! Seek cover immediately.
Attention stalkers! An emission will start any minute now. Find cover if you want to live!

The documents refer to a central laboratory, designated X8, which yould contain information about secret experiments conducted in the Zone. Our analysts have been interested in this issue for quite some time.

Looks like the crew died in mid-air, and the helicopter simply crashed because there was nobody there to fly it. The on-board computer was a little luckier. I wonder if there's anything useful here... Ah, there's something...! A map of the area, with certain locations marked. That should come in handy.
The electronics are the same here, but the emission protection system is intact. What could've caused this?
All the electronics inside burned out. Even the power cable sheathe is melted.
There, that's better! Now you can come on over, and we'll talk.
One!
Two!
Three!
Put your shooter away!
I told you to put your shooter away. I'm going to count to three, and if you don't do it, I'll blow your freakin' head off!
I don't feel like beating gums. Talk to the commander!
The commander is the one to speak to if something comes up.
Are you dumb? Get back, before I blow your brains out!
All right, people, it's time to head back. You're useless, so don't expect a reward.
Talk to the boss. I'm more into shooting than beating gums.
I've asked everywhere, but it's useless. Nobody knows a thing. It's like he's a poltergeist or something.
It's over. Our job is done, let's head back. Remember to pop in to see Trapper at Yanov, and tell him the wounded chimera is done with to get your share.
Nicely done! You should look into hunting chimeras as a profession.
We're there. It's close, I can sense it. If you see it, aim for the head. Don't get too close though, chimeras can smell you a mile off, even when they're sleeping.

Listen now! The chimera hunts at night and returns to its lair in the morning for some beauty rest. We can catch it off-guard at dawn, when it's at rest. All we have to do is get close to it and kill it while it's still sleeping. Simple enough. We'll have to get up early though. Let's meet at the bar at... 3 in the morning.
Careful! We got to be real quiet, we can't let it hear us.
The bastard is sleeping... Crab says hello. Fire!
That son of a bitch is going to regret running away.
So, did you find anything out about Magpie?
Hang in there, buddy, the doc said you'll be up on your feet in a couple of days. You might as well use this time to rest up and chill.
Hey stalker! Come here! I got a question for you.
Good! Now turn around, slowly, and piss off back to where you came from!
Are you dumb or something? Get outta here!
Hey, douchebag! Is anyone even there? Scram, or I'll drop you right friggin now!
I'm going to bleed you dry, asshole!
You're going down, cocksucker!
Gimme the artefact, retard!
What an asshole!
Stay still and don't even think about moving, asshole! One wrong move and you're toast!
Stop right there! Holster your weapon, and don't you move!
Hey, Beard, check out what I found on that old tub! Will this do?
Wow, that's something else...! I've never seen one of these before. Here, take this.
Thank you. If you have any more work, you know where to find me.
Just do keep walking. You'll remember this moment, that's for sure.
Oh it's you... Well, I need cash as much as you do.
Aah... This is it! This is the end! It's here... Mutants... mutants everywhere!
This crap won't save you when the muties crawl out of the woodwork. Here, take this and get out of my face!
Ha! You think that will protect you from a emission? Here, take this and run. Save your skin!
Then beat it, weirdo!
Go to hell, freakin' muties!!
Get out of here you bastards, or I'll take you all out!
Mutant assholes... Piss off!
Leave me alone.
Keep moving.
Clear off.
Watch carefully, and follow me.
Nice job! Feel free to drop by sometime.

So that's where those damn mutants are. They climbed up to the plateau, thinking that Noah won't get to them. I guess they don't know that I've got a personal path up there by the northern farmstead. You're in for a fun ride, assholes!
Well, good luck to you!
Good hunting!
Hello.
Hey, stalker. How are you?

Recording 12. My research will be over soon... People at the camp are starting to suspect something. Grouse and Danila are planning to hunt some bloodsuckers... I wonder when they'll figure it out? I need to sort the jars of blood to find out which ones have been contaminated... And hide the rest... Someone's coming. ... Recording 13. Possibly my last. First that nosey hunter, and now Grouse. I won't get away with this. They'll come for me. I know it. ... Doesn't really matter. ... This hemoglobin dependency will kill me soon anyway. And I'd rather die from a bullet than a disease.
Yes, of course. Good bye.
Goodbye.
What's up? You wounded, or suffering from radiation sickness?
No, not now... Yes?
I knew I'd be exposed eventually. ... I'm sure you have many questions.

Information on the on-board computer... Okay, so Stingray-3 had engine failure in both engines. Hmm... What else is there?... A map with what look like possible evacuation locations. Positions B2, B28 and B205. Interesting.
The job is done. Here's the artefact.
Job's done. Here, take the artefact.
How's it hanging, stalker?
Uhh... What do you want...?
Uhm... Did you forget something?
Mm? What...? Let me sleep...
Come on, leave me alone...!
It's over there... Help yourself to a drink!
What... What can I do you for?...
Aah... Eh, it's you... Come in!
What? Six... Sixty-two...? That's impossible.
[fell asleep]
...I'm telling you, there's not enough juice...
[fell asleep]
Hey, guys, where are you going...? Nah, I'll... I'll stay here...
Howdy...
Here's to a steady hand!
Here's to a good day's work!
Here's to our common goal!
This is Owl. Come see me! We need to talk about our business.
That's right, get on outta here!
Don't let the door hit you...
So, you got anything new?
What are you, a statue? If you got something, spill the beans. If not, take a hike!
Wow, that's a nice shooter! Let me have a look at it.
I saw a bloodsucker enter the building. I'm guessing that's their lair... But let's put that theory to the test.
Look out! There's another one!
Did you hear that? ... Nevermind, I must be hearing things.
They're waking up! Run!
Shh! It's full of sleeping bloodsuckers. Let's try to get by them without making any noise.
Come, look at this! ... It's probably the only way of getting into the basement.
Please, hold your applause! Now, let's take a look inside.
Your footsies still intact? Let's check out this basement then.
Phew... we made it. And didn't even disturb their nap time.
I think I found the lair. Get over here, ASAP!
Watch where you're shooting!
What the hell are you doing? You shot me!
Well, jumping down is the only way... Follow me!
This looks like an exit! Jump!
One down! But there were two of them, so watch out!
That should be it. That was the last one.
No hunter here... Jesus! Check it out, it's claw marks. The guys we found before weren't clawed. Weird.
Look at the claw marks! Strange...
The bodies we found before didn't have those.
The hunter isn't here, let's go!
Watch the shadows! They can appear from anywhere.
There's something there. Cover me!
Get down!

We didn't find the hunter, but I have an idea where he might be. Let me check it out, then I'll contact you. While I do that, let the stalkers know about these blood-sucking assholes. Something needs to be done about them.
We need to tell Beard about this. Let's hope he'll know how to deal with these bastards
This is what I do. I've been picking locks all my life.

I'm positive the artefact is on the tree itself. It's clear from here that I can climb onto the tree from the hill. I just hope the hills are free of mutants. It's too bad I had to come here on my own after that argument with Cardan and Barge. But when I bring back the artefact, they'll see I was right all along.
Okay, drop that retard!
Turn back, stalker! This place ain't for you!
Stalker! Off with you, while you still got legs!
Leave here man.
Go, get out of here while you can!

Cardan, that old drunk! Not only is he a lazy bastard once he's had a drink, 'It's better here. We need to take it easy...' But then he goes and takes a rant at me and Joker, saying we're young and ain't got a clue! Haha...! Eh, Joker's a piece of work too. Gets pissed up, grabs his bag and disappears. While I was trying to calm Cardan down, he left and hell if I know where he went. And what am I supposed to do? Drink with that senile moron? No, thank you, his vodka is shit! Eww. And to think how promising things were at the beginning...
Look, we've got these here artefacts, and we can get more of them. In exchange, we're looking for weapons, and some good equipment.
Hey! Who goes there?
You, idiot, brought that tail with you!
What have you got, show me!
You know that I've got whatever Duty's got, so weapons and equipment are not a problem. All my stuff is top quality, no doubt about it.
Execute them. I don't need witnesses.
Here they come.
Take them down!
We'll wait here. The clients should show up soon.
Why don't we have a little chat, you and I?
What's going on?
Well, that clears things up. Take them down!
Ask the boss.
Don't let the sentry see you.
Stalkers? What the...?!
Take them down, boys!
Good. Now get the hell out of here, before I change my mind!
You're still here? I'm not a patient man you know...
Okay, that's it! You're going down!
Cut it out, dipshit!
Bros, he doesn't want to cooperate. Drop him!
Bros, this asshole doesn't want to share!
That's that dude with the nice shooter! Hey, wait up!
Wait there! I'm coming down!
Just relax and keep moving.
See, your suit can handle it. Keep going!
Help me, stalker!
See you... If you manage to stay in one piece, that is.
Drop by some time. We'll have a good time!
The man himself!
So, you managed to drag your ass over here? Bravo!
Well, that's that. ... What the hell were you doing? Admiring the scenery?
Well, that's that! It was sweet watching you work.
We'll give it to 'em good!
Hey, what's going on?
Take a chill pill, man! We'll take them easy.
Let's do it!
So...! We've been waiting for you a long time now.
What the...?! Did they hide, or something?
Listen up! Sultan wants to see you.
We got the bastards. You're not keen to get involved in a real fight, are you?
We got the bastards. Thanks for your help!
Kill them all!
Would you look at that! The man himself!
Holster that shooter, stalker, or I'm putting you right in the ground!
What do I do? If I go, I'll lose money. If I don't go, I'll end up dead.
Why... Is that change I still hear chingiling in your pockets?... Well, is it?
One more step, and he's dead!
Put that shooter away, sharpish!
Hey! What are you doing here? Go back to where you came from while you still got legs.
Let's roll!
I'll cover you.
Moving out.
I'm in position.
I still think that we should sell the artefact and use the money to recruit people. This way we can attack the bandits together.
You don't think they'll shoot him as soon as they have the artefact?
We can't give in to them. No matter what you give them, they always want more.
No way! We're much better off giving them the artefact as ransom.
They'll definitely shoot him if we come out blasting.
We're not giving in...! Complying with their conditions is the only option we have.
I don't trust you.
Run! We can still make it!
Thanks for saving me.
Hey, where are you going? Wait! Come back here!
I'll meet you by the old train station.
Attention all stalkers and anyone else who cares, Yanov station has been attacked! We've blocked all the entrances for the time being.
Put that gun away. This is a neutral area.
We're in the firing line as it is, stalker. If you don't put that weapon away, you're asking for trouble.
So long as there's a gun in your hand, you ain't gettin' in. You got that?!
Slow down, chief. Put that shooter away first.
We don't allow weapons inside.
Stalker, if you want to enter, holster your weapon.
Attention all stalkers and anyone else who cares, Yanov is secure again. You're welcome to visit anytime.
See you again some time, stalker!
Okay, that's us. Have a good one!
Hello, stalker.
What's your business here?
Good luck!
Take care!
Hey, man! What's up?
Come on in, man, relax. Take your load off.
Pop in some time. It can be fun around here.
See you!
Come on over, bro! I've got all the shit you're ever gonna need.
Aloha!
The emission is over. I hope everyone's okay. If you're hurt, come to Yanov and we'll patch you up.
Next! ...er... I mean... take care and stay healthy!
Stay out of trouble!
You're a touch pale, buddy. How about a little injection or two?
Wounded again? You don't waste any time, do you.
Attention, attention! An emission is approaching. Find cover immediately!
Attention, attention! An emission is about to hit! Find cover immediately!
So... The underpass was filled with gas after it was sealed.
The entrance to the underpass is here. If we activate the generator, we'll be able to open the transportation lock.
Schematics for the 'Pripyat-1' underpass. This is proof that there is an underground way to get to Pripyat.
Hey, man! Time is money. We're done waiting for you, the squad is going back now.
Wat... watch... watch out, contro... control... controller!
Uhm... holy... what... what is...? What... again...
Ooh... impulse... ...bleh... terrible...! Man, my head is killing me!
We'll wait for you here. If anything happens, we got your back.
Oh, crap! We've better get out of here, pronto!
So you're the hole expert, eh? He-he-he... Don't worry, you can count on the boys to take the muties out, nice and quick.
Hmm... it looks quiet. We can advance.
It's all good. There were a few hamsters in there, but we dealt with them.
Look like that was the last of them.
Aargh... It's inside me! Nooo...
Go! We'll cover the entrance.
It's a zombie!
Well... ...Er... Y-You know...
Huh? What?
Er... Well...
Hiya, it's Nitro. Swing by for that memory module. It's ready for you.
What's up?
Ok, it's a deal: we'll go together. Whatever fighters you see, send them my way and I'll make a team out of them. Once everything is ready, give me a shout. We'll pick up Nitro and head for Jupiter.
Looks like a quiet village... unless we disturb the local residents.
So peaceful, it's like a resort.
We're almost there.
Get up here, things are about to kick off!
Come on, what are you waiting for? You'll miss the best part.
What are you doing? Hurry up, the fun stuff is about to start.
So, that's that. I can see you're bursting with questions, and I can understand that. Let's have a little talk, shall we?
Looks like I was right after all. Now the zombies are gonna cover us, shoot those bastards down!
Looks like I was right after all. Shoot those bastards down!
Let's see if I was right.
What did you do that for? He didn't touch you, did he. Damn!
Sultan, I've dealt with that loser real good. That will teach him not to mess with us.
Sultan sends his regards. Open wide, punk!

I got to get away from these assholes, the sooner the better. The loot I've stashed behind the substation should last me a while. It's time to move on. I'm sure they are already looking for me. It's all right tho. We'll see who gets who in the end.
Hey! Get out of here! Duty members only.
Gavrilenko! I found out about the warehouse. It's Freedom, and there should be lots of them. Bring your whole squad and we'll deal those punks real fast.
If this checks out, you'll get access to the warehouse.
Attention, Freedom! This is Duty territory. Get the hell away from the warehouse!
Bastards...! Well, they asked for it. Men, commence with the operation!
This ain't no public part, boy. You'd best be on your way.
Kremen! Take your men and join Haiduk at the warehouse. Those Duty bastards should come for their stuff any minute now.
Great! Now the boys will be able to fight them off. I don't forget favours, so you can use the stash anytime you want. I'll let everyone know.
Sure thing! Just give us a minute to stock up on some ammo.
Hey, it's Trapper. I just had a hunter here who saw a chimera last night. Judging by the description it's the same one we're after. Come, see me if you can. It's important.
Here we are. Yanov station is a haven of relative safety in the area around Jupiter. This is where we go on our separate ways. But if you need me, look for me by the bar.
Later!
See you around!
Hey there!
'Sup!

First time here? I'm relatively new here myself. The name's Nitro. I work with equipment. I can repair anything you need. But... getting some good tools is a problem around here. If you see anything, bring it straight to me. And if you need any technical help, come see me, and I'll be glad to do what I can for you.
That's good. Go.
Everyone's ready, open it up.
Ready! Squad?
Clear!
Also, ready.
I have a bad feeling about this.
I'm always ready!
Gah...! Come on!
Roger. Let's rock!
Good to go?
There we go! That's better.
Good luck boys!
Have a good one!
Happy hunting!
Howdy!
How goes the hunt?
Well, I propose a toast to a brave squad of Duty men, sent to the front lines for some serious green scum ass kicking.

Have I told you the story about Flint? First he set up stalker hunters to get attacked by a chimera, then he left his partner to die in an anomaly and then he joined Freedom. I'd say that's a pretty logical conclusion right there. So, I'd say we drink to the hope that all members of Freedom follow his lead and we'll take care of whoever is left.
Let's drink to the fact that even in the center of the Zone there are people who are willing to serve Duty. To our new squad!
I raise my glass to the fact that this research complex is now fully protected by Duty from mutants, anarchists and other scum.
Fellows! Let's drink to honour our brave volunteers for taking readings in some of the Zone's most dangerous areas for the good of our scientific progress.
I propose a toast to Duty fighters who courageously fought off a cowardly attack made by those filthy punks.
Damn right!
Totally!
Well said!
Couldn't agree more.
He's dead already. And if it were up to me I'd have all of you follow suit. Teach you to quit exporting the Zone's products outside driven by that same greed.
Nobody knows what really happened. It's not like you were there to see it.

Is that a squad made up of Monolith people? Well, I hope you'll find yourself a bloodsucker squad too, 'cause once you do, the Lieutenant Colonel will definitely add you to the list of dangerous mutants.
Ha! Some guard you are. Just last year the Mercenaries had you running around the Dark Valley with your tail between your legs. Or have you forgotten?
Yes, I can imagine the readings the scientists are getting. Air samples: 100% smoke, water samples: 100% vodka, and idiotic laughter on all sound frequencies.

That's all right. We'll get our weapons back. You guys have developed a nifty habit of dropping weapons and artefacts whenever you run into our fighters. I don't blame you either. Can't be easy holding at it, what, with your pants shat and all?

Boys! Have you heard how Duty is sticking to its traditions? Take Warrant Officer Morgan, in following the strict need to maintain his faction's reputation he thought it was his 'duty' to sell off half his warehouse on the sight.

Fall in! Remember? Duty's stalwart traditions were laid down by General Tkachenko himself. He lied to his comrades, misled the HQ and bravely died in a Space Bubble. Here's to all members of Duty following his lead.

You know, the first time I saw our new squad I asked them, 'Fellows, would you prefer to join Duty instead? You're free to do as you like, after all.' You know, they said to me, 'No, thank you. With them, it's all about the orders. To give, primarily. No wonder their eyes are empty. We've had enough of zombies.'

A member of Duty came up to one of our people, got in the bunker and asked him, 'Professor, could you tell me which artefact is best for fighting boars? Wrenched to protect you from radiation, or Eye to help you with wounds.' Do you know what the answer was? 'Shell is what you need, son. If you see a boar, run back to your base as fast as you can.' Haha!

People, you know how the scientists came to choose our boys to take anomaly measurements? They actually went to see Shulga first and said to him, 'There's a job that needs doing for the benefit of science.' And he said, 'No problem. Who do I have to execute?'

With every day that goes by the need for Duty becomes clearer to me. I mean, who else would put together a whole warehouse of weapons and ammo, and then donate it to Freedom? It was really nice of them, wouldn't you say?
[laughter]
[laughter]
[laughter]
[laughter]
Yeah? Well, I seem to remember how your brave squad was on their knees groveling for access to Yanov before an emission.
Everyone's got one of those. Duty is a real haven for hypocrites. 'We'll protect the world from the Zone', right after we collect a few artefacts.
Good deal. Fanatic should stick with fanatics. You should wear Monolith uniforms too. Lest stalkers might actually confuse you for humans.
From mutants? You sure you'll have enough space in that bunker when the mutants come out in force? It's not like it's the 100 Rads bar. You can't just hole up there and wait it out.
If your volunteers drink as much as you do, I can only imagine the readings scientists are getting.
Yeah, that's right. Bring in as many guards as you can. Now half the Zone knows about your equipment warehouse, so expect visitors.
Hold on...! Find him! Worst is yet... argh...

You should have seen me getting this one artefact the other day. That was something. You know anything about the Quarry? Well. Whatever decent shit there once was is long gone. There's no point looking in anomalies Flint has looked in. Everyone knows that.

I'll tell you everything there is to say about bloodsuckers. When I was at Zaton, those assholes made life real difficult for just about everyone. Stalkers kept at 'em day and night but it didn't help one bit. Poor bastards. One day I decided to help them out. So I took my shotgun and went straight for the bloodsucker lair. Three days I was partying with those sons of bitches, at times taking on two or even three together. After some quality time with yours truly the bloodsucker problem at Zaton is all but over. The bastards keep their tentacles tucked in at all times.

Okay, I'll tell you how to kill controllers. The other day I chanced upon a buttload of artefacts and decided to stash them while still en route 'cause my back couldn't hack it any-more. On the way back I got to my stash and there it was, a controller, chilling right on top of it. Now I thought to myself, 'Controller or no controller, I got to get my shit back.' Then I realized that if I shield myself with something its manipulation bullshit won't work on me. So, I picked up a metal grate that I found lying around and started sneaking up on the beast. By the time it woke up to what was going on I pumped off a clip into the cocksucker's head. Just as it started trying to control me I gave it a final bash with my rifle butt and that was that.
Ah! Now that's some story, Flint.
Flint's a real man, that's for sure.
Yeah... Not bad.

Well, I'm sure you know about the path from Zaton... No? Well, the guide used to take a massive detour. What I did was create a shortcut by cutting across a straight line, a novel idea. I tried a few places and worked out the way through the anomalies pretty quick. So I sold that info to the guide and now he takes everyone that way.

You heard about the Oasis? Of course you've heard of it. I, on the other hand, have actually been there. I was the first person to work out the way to get there, a pioneer if you will. There ain't no mutants or friggin' anomalies there. It's quiet as a graveyard and full of artefacts. I was there only a few days ago. Sunday, do you know that... Lead you there? Ha! Sorry, but I don't want it getting crowded. Nothing personal.

Well, I've got a lot of stories to tell. Did I tell you about my time working for the scientists? So, one day I go and pop in to their bunker, real curious to see what they're up to in there. At first they're all in shock. But then they go, 'You're exactly what we need right now.' It turns out they wanted to set up their devices under anomalies. Obviously the eggheads didn't feel like doing it themselves, so they promised me cash and other goodies. So I was like, 'Well, that's fine, but the goodies better be worth it!' I had to crawl around that area looking for anomalies but it wasn't half as hard as getting those nerds to fork up their award money.
Cool story!
Yeah!
Wow!

There might be a few folk who think that Flint is telling lies. Well, they can ask anyone at the base about me. Even the squad of pro hunters, when they spotted me the other day they were all like, 'We need you, Flint. We can't do it without you.' They were hunting a chimera, so I had to show these 'pros' how it's done. My ammo is real friggin' simple. I just head straight into the lair. They left one rookie by the entrance to keep an eye out for it. Of course, come morning, as soon as the newbie saw the beast he shat his pants and legged it, so I had to deal with it myself. Successfully, as you can see, he-he-he...
Fall in!
Single rank, now!
Congratulations on joining Duty! Follow me! Left, right, left, right...
See? You can do it when you want to. Time to take the oath.
Do you swear to serve Duty with courage and integrity, to protect humanity from the Zone's aggression, and always follow the code?
So, any questions?
Why do you standing around for? Have a seat and let's talk!
We don't have a strict hierarchy. Earn our respect, and you'll get plenty of followers. However, when on a mission we obey the commander's orders without question.

We respect the freedom of our members and other stalkers, and we believe that the Zone is open to all. Being the greatest gift humanity has ever received, it's an opportunity to take a tremendous leap in our development, and everyone needs to understand that.
So, welcome to Freedom!
Who will command us?
Stalker! Could you come over here?
You'd be better off speaking to Strider.
Strider is the one you ought to talk to.
We can sit around here all day, but that won't get us anywhere.
There's nothing but mutants around here.
And where do we go?
The first thing we need to do is work out where the hell we are.
We need to find people.
We're screwed, whatever we do.
Cool!
We swear it!
Great! That's just we need.
We swear it!
Attention, attention! This is Hermann. The science laboratory is under attack. We won't be allowing stalkers in for a while.
Attention, attention! This is Hermann. Our mobile laboratory is open to stalkers once again.
Stalker! I must warn you that entering the bunker with a weapon is strictly prohibited.
Stalker! You must holster your weapon by the entrance to the research facility.
You hear me? Holster your weapon!

...whichever way we go, we always end up at the same exact spot. I still can't get used to this fog. It's weird that Chepurnoy disappeared without a trace. Maybe he found a way out. ... Day six. We've ran out of water. The Colonel flipped his lid and shot two people at point blank range, and then himself. Now I'm on my own in this damn anomaly. If I hadn't fixed for our communications with HQ to go down, they could've rescued us. And Duty wouldn't have existed. I wonder how things would've turned out. ... Ah, screw it! That Captain Tkachenko died a long time ago. And this General Tkachenko of Duty will follow him. That's... Justice, I suppose.
...find a way out. Help! We're running low on...
...much longer. We've been without water for two day. Requesting a rescue mission! Hel...
...require immediate assistance! We won't hold out for more than three...
You shouldn't have come here, stalker! Now you'll be wormfood.
See you next time!
Don't be a stranger!
Hello! It's always nice to see a new face in our bunker.
Oh... hello!
Good luck!
Bye!
Hello!
Hey!
Thank you for your time.
Is that everything? Good bye then.
Ehh... very well, come on over. What can I do for you?
Yes, you have my undivided attention.
Okay, let's do this fast. The quicker we finish the more chance we have of staying alive.
Alpha, beta and gamma radiation readings taken.
Taking readings!
Torsion field scan complete.
We're getting there. The torsion field scan is almost done.
We're done here, stalker. Now let's get the hell out of here!
Hey! Are you covering us, or what?
Look alive, stalker! Cover us!
Hey! What are you doing?!
Stalker! They're here! Help us!
Stalker! What the hell are you doing?!
They're attacking us! Stalker, what the...
Electromagnetic field scan complete.
Electromagnetic field scan in progress.
Acoustic data acquired for all ranges.
Acoustic data collected for two ranges so far.
Stingray-4, come in! Come in, dammit! Stingray-4, do you read? ... Attention, Stingray group! This is Stingray-1. The emergency evacuation position is B-Two-Eight. I repeat, B-Two-Eight!

Two bodies... Looks like they died in the crash. ... Everything of value has been looted and the on-board computer has been wiped clean. But the black box is still intact. ... Interesting. ... I reckon a decent technician will be able to extract the information on it and then decode it.
It's blocked, and there's no button. I get the feeling someone's going to have to make for the control room to solve this one.
I'll wait down here and cover our backs, okay?
Damn, I knew we shouldn't have come here.
No point standing around here, that's for sure.
Great! Just great!
My gut feeling is that we've made it.
So... How about pressing the button?
Great! The gate has no power.
Careful! Something is wrong here.
Uh-oh!
Shit!
Man, they don't let up, do they.
Mmmh... something doesn't feel right.
Mmmh... something feels wrong here too.
Hey, you'll be careful with that thing, all right?
I'm getting a strange feeling, and not the good kind.
Hey! So, are we moving or what?
Why did I even get into this?
The hell with this place! I can't wait till I'm outta here.
I can't believe this shit they told me. 'Don't worry, piloting is easy as pie.' My ass!
Quiet! Keep it nice and quiet!
We'll talk once we get out of here.
This is hardly the time to talk.
Are you crazy?!
Ooh... watch it, asshole!
Ooh... stop it! You're hurting me!
Ugh... friggin' psycho!
[Sokolov dies]
Vano is dead.
Strider has been killed.
Zulu is down.
[Sokolov gets hurt]
[Sokolov gets hurt]
[Sokolov gets hurt]
Hey, come back! It's dangerous.
Oh, there's an anomaly here.
Let's see if there's a way of getting through this.
Come! I've found a way through.
Another anomaly. Let's see.
Hm... go this way once, it may be your last.
Okay, there's a way through here. Let's hope it leads somewhere a little less deadly.
Okay, let's move.
So... the gate is blocked, huh? Hmm... I don't know... Maybe it can be opened from the control room?
Keep moving, buddy! I've got your rear covered. Don't you worry.
Well, I'll be... That's beautiful!
Door's open over there. Shall we go that way?
Look it! Press the button or something, yeah?
There's been a power cut, huh-huh...
Hey! Don't go there! It's closed off.
Look! It's open now!
Muzzle flash on the right... er... I mean, left.
Nice, they're all dead.
Listen, there should be levers on this thing that you can turn stuff on with.
So... Let's go?
Hey, man! Quit wasting time. Do it long enough and we'll get wasted ourselves.
You know, it's not so bad here... I think.
With loyal friends by your side even this shit ain't that bad.
It's a good thing I decided to follow you. How else could I've seen a place like this?
Let's talk afterwards, buddy.
Listen, this isn't the best time to chat.
I'll be honest with you. This is neither the time nor the place to talk.
What the... You bastard!
Why, dude? Why?...
I ain't the enemy, man!
I'll friggin' end you!
[Vano dies]
Our army friend is dead.
Our Monolith comrade has been killed.
It's Zulu! He's dead.
[Vano gets hurt]
[Vano gets hurt]
[Vano gets hurt]
Hey, man! Where are you going? Let's work together on this one!
The gate is blocked. If I were you, I'd have a look around the control room.
I'll stay here and cover the approaches.
The door is open. Shall we go?
You gotta press the button.
We're out in the open here. Let's move!
Looks like there's no power being supplied to the gate.
They are mine.
They're toast.
I'll deal with these bastards.
A transformer. I remember these from my childhood.
Let's move!
This isn't the best place to twiddle your thumbs, let's go!
It's quiet. Too quiet.
I think I may have been here at some point. I'm not sure.
Strange... Everything about this place is strange.
Zip it, will ya?!
Quiet down, man.
I... I don't feel like talking.
Traitor!
Uhm, that's... unnecessary.
I suggest you stop that right now!
Uhm... I warned you!
[Strider dies]
Sokolov is dead.
Vano is gone.
Zulu has been killed.
[Strider gets hurt]
[Strider gets hurt]
[Strider gets hurt]
Don't rush ahead! It's best to stick together around here.
The gate is blocked, and there's no button here. Anyone feel like going to the control room and seeing if there's anything there to help us?
Keep moving, bro! I've got your back.
Well, the way is clear. Let's go!
Looks like we're underneath Pripyat.
Press the button, bro!
Back to back, quickly!
Damn!
Hm... looks like the direct route is not an option.
No worries. Real men often take the backdoor.
Well, at least the protective suits will get some use.
Hm... the power to the gate has been cut.
Snipers!
Stay calm. Open... fire!
Well, bro... let's rock and roll!
Mess with the best, die like the rest.
This looks like a transformer. I wonder if all the lines have been activated.
Let's move!
Keep up, bro! We've got to keep moving forward.
What a place, man.
What a mess! You'd get an asskicking for this kind of thing at our base.
This place is no Sandy Beach, that's for sure.
No time for banter, brother.
Let's talk once this is over.
Quit this chatter and focus!
Hey! He was my friend!
Ugh! What the hell are you doing?!
Argh! Hey, stop it!
Urgh! Hey, I don't stand for that kind of shit!
[Zulu dies]
Sokolov is down!
Vano is down!
Strider is down!
[Zulu gets hurt]
[Zulu gets hurt]
[Zulu gets hurt]
Come back, bro! We don't need a scout on this mission.
I'm Major Degtyarev, USS. I'm here to investigate the failure of operation 'Fairway'.
Stalkers helped me to get to Pripyat.
Let him go, Captain.
I have information for Kovalsky. Take me to him.
Follow me!
Okay. Follow me.
Put your weapons on the ground, now!
You're a merry gang, ain't you?
Fine, screw him!
Hold it!
Who are you? What's your business with the commander?
I knew it!
Don't shoot! I'm Lieutenant Sokolov, co-pilot of Stingray-4. I'm on my way to B28 emergency position.
You know Kovalsky?
What do you think we're here for, fun? Why so trigger-happy? Can't you see that we're all friends here? Me and agent D-De... have been through a lot. Trust me on that.
And I don't give a rat's ass who's working for who.
...or the USS.
I have no business with the army...
I'm not going.
USS?... What the...?
Major, speak to the Colonel if you need something.
You must be looking for the Colonel, Major.
Colonel Kovalsky is the person to speak to, sir.
Talk to Kovalsky, Major.
Kovalsky is the man to speak to, sir.
Sir, you should see Kovalsky if you need something.
Attention all units! This is Colonel Kovalsky. The base is under attack. The entrance has been blocked until the threat is eliminated.
Major, if you don't mind, could you holster that weapon?
Listen, Major, holster your weapon, would you? We won't shoot you, you have my word.
Come on, Major. Put your gun away for God's sake. Everyone's jumpy enough as it is.
Attention all units! This is Colonel Kovalsky. The threat has been eliminated.
Attention all units! This is Colonel Kovalsky. The emission is over.
Attention all units! This is Colonel Kovalsky. According to our readings an emission is approaching. Take cover immediately!
Attention all units! This is Colonel Kovalsky. An emission is starting, I repeat, an emission is starting. Take cover immediately!

We thank you, Monolith, for revealing the cunning plans of Your enemies to us. May Your light shine down on the souls of the brave soldiers who gave their lives in service to Your will. Onward, warriors of the Monolith! Avenge your fallen brothers, blessed as they are in their eternal union with the Monolith. Bring death to those who spurn the holy power of the Monolith!
They'll spot you like that, Major.
It's clear! Let's move!
Let's wait until they get to the center of the yard.
The target is in position.
They're leaving!
We must act before we're spotted. Open fire!
Ice, get to the roof. The rest of you, follow me.
Get in position.
Ready to attack on your order.
Strange. Is someone leaking our plans to them? We should take this to Kovalsky.
It's an ambush! Take cover!
Great shot, Major.
Let's check them out. Ice, cover us!
These fanatics knew about us!
Ice, wake the hell up!
You'd better ask the Captain.

Kovalsky, something strange is going on here. There were loads of Monolith fighters inside the building. They were all in a trance, and talking to... A pile of trash. I examined this pile, and if you cut through the crap, it resembles a primitive antenna. It seems that someone talks to them through this antenna... And they believe it to be divine intervention.
This is all very strange. Someone's controlling these fanatics... Hmm. We'll get back to this later.
This is all very strange. Someone's controlling these fanatics... Hmm. We'll get back to this later. The sentry hasn't showed up yet, so let me know if you find him. Over and out.
Monolith, we do not hear you.
Why have you left us, Monolith?
We await your orders, Monolith.
Lieutenant Skelya, at your disposal.
Holy shit, this place is teeming with them!
You know, I thought I'd be safer with you.
Here we are.
Take them out before they snap out of it!
I signed up as soon as I found out you need help. I'll follow you to the bitter end, man.
The recon unit had information about the location of Monolith forces. The notes indicate the bookstore.
The recon unit only spotted Monolith patrols. They didn't see any large squads or units.
I found the unit. They're all dead. Looks like they were shot, but there's no trace of the enemy.

I don't understand how they could've attacked so suddenly, without leaving any evidence. Really strange. ... Major, we just picked up the sentry's signal! The coordinates place him somewhere near the grocery store. Check it out if you can. I'm counting on you, Major. Over and out.
We need to find the recon unit. Major, find out what happened! What the hell... Hmm. You be careful out there, okay? And, Major... Keep me posted!
It's those damned fanatics. We need to deal with them.
It's those damned fanatics, they don't let up. We're also missing a sentry; he's not answering, and there's not a trace of him either. We've got to take care of those bastards, once and for all.
Very well, I'll be sending two boys your way. They'll meet you near the target. Over and out.

Very well, I'll be sending two boys your way. They'll meet you near the target. And another thing... We've just picked up the sentry's signal. The coordinates place him somewhere near the grocery store. Check it out if you can. I'm counting on you, Major. Over and out.
Recon unit, come in! What is going on out there?
I don't understand how they could've attacked so suddenly. Without leaving any evidence. Really strange. I need to think things over. We'll speak again soon.
I've received a message from the recon unit.
No! ... What the hell is that? ... Wait! ... We're all dead... Argh... Help! Someone help me! Get that thing away from me! Nooo...
Wow, I can't believe we made it to Pripyat unscathed. How did you even manage to find this path?
It's not that difficult. All you need is skill and a bit of luck, and we've got both. Or maybe it's the Zone, rewarding us for our patience. God knows, I paid my dues with the scientists.
Yeah. I've had enough of Hermann myself.
Base, the sentry is dead. He was acting strange and attacked me. I also identified and eliminated a controller in that area.
Base, the sentry is dead. He was acting strange and attacked me. I also found a controller in that area, so I had to fall back.
Base, the controller has been elminated.

Copy that, Major. The controller must have taken over the sentry. Eh. He was a good guy. ... Hm. That must have been what happened to the recon unit. The controller forced them to attack each other. Anyway, over and out.
Copy that, Major. The controller must have taken over the sentry. You need to kill that asshole, right now! We're at great risk as long as it's still alive.
Major, Kovalsky here. We've got another emergency on our hands. Get over here and I'll fill you in on the details.

Major, I have a favour to ask. Our sentry isn't responding. You know where the grocery store used to be? That's where his signal is coming from. Investigate it if you can. One other thing. Be careful. Over and out.
Ah, Major. Come in.
Leave me alone, go away!
No! No, no!
Base, I found one of your men. It looks like he blew himself up with a grenade. There are no signs of a firefight or any other evidence of him being attacked.
Kovalsky here. ... Roger that, Major. Hey, I got good news. We finally acquired the exact coordinates of the source of interference. The signal is coming from the kindergarten building.

Our communications expert believes that the signal is being jammed from somewhere close to us. He's working on getting the coordinates as we speak. I sent some of my men to check out a possible source of interference, but they went missing, and their personal signals aren't registering.

Major, we got a serious problem. This operation has been getting more ridiculous every minute since the helicopters crashed. The men are dropping like flies, we've got no comms with HQ, and the situation just keeps getting worse. The evacuation choppers didn't show up, again. And at this rate it won't be long before we lose control of the situation completely. We need to establish communications with HQ, right now.

Major, one of your objectives is to establish communications with HQ. Given the situation we find ourselves in, this should be your priority from now on. Also, as a personal favour to me, please, find my boys.
Major, I need to talk to you. Privately.
I'm by the building, but all the entrances are blocked.
The squad sent to look for the source of interference had explosives. Use them to clear the entrance.
The stalker and the Stingray squad are dead. Prepare for take-off.
That's everyone, except for the stalker. He's dead. Prepare for take-off.
Major Degtyarev here. I read you.

[Major Degtyarev] I've managed to acquire documents about experiments carried out in the Zone. Furthermore, we've been contacted by a stalker who's been in the CNPP. His name is Strelok, and he's offered us his cooperation.

[Major Degtyarev] Yes, I have the data. And Strelok's information confirms it. The helicopters were hit by anomalies after their locations changed during the emissions. The anomaly maps issued to their pilots turned out to be useless.
[Major Degtyarev] Strelok believes that the helicopters went into anomalies. The location of anomalies changes after every emission; a fact that was missed when making the map for Operation Fairway.
Get in the chopper! I hope it was worth it...
Let's get to the chopper, and we'll talk in the air, okay?
We'll have plenty of time to talk later. We need to make sure we have enough ammo.
Well, this was a decent base. The old girl kept us alive; can't ask for more than that. But now we got to get to the birds and fly home.
Let's talk after. My jaws jam up during emissions.
Another emission, I'm getting real tired of them.
Argh... I feel like I'm in a trench with tanks rolling over it.
Huh?... Okay, run!
It's here!
Man, I thought acid rain was bad enough around here.
Forget about it. I trade it for rain any day of the weekend, twice on Sunday.
Damn, that's loud! My ears are still ringing, I feel like I'm deaf.
What? Hehheh... Just messing with you.
Hehh... Every time there's an emission I get this splitting headache.
As long as the emission ain't killing you I say that's pretty good going.
What was that?!
Zombies!
There's about a dozen zombies in the building.
Colonel, why did comms go down?
Okay. All right, listen up, operation Fairway is being taken over by the USS. Is Major Degtyarev there?
Okay. He's in command from now on. Tell him to stay put. He'll be contacted by a superior shortly.
Would you look at that! The sons of bitches actually made it... You were right, Strelok.
There's no time! Check your weapons and fire at will!
Major, can I have a word?
It looks like the emission is over. Kirillov, contact HQ.
Major, we can't wait any longer.
Get ready, men!
Come on, boys! One last push!
Move out, squad!
Fire at will! Go!
Move to the left and cover each other!
You heard the news, fellows. When we go, stick together and keep the stalker alive. Any questions?... Get ready to move!
Through the arch!
Stay alert and follow orders! We're real close to the evacuation point. Let's move!
Shit! It's Monolith fighters! Fire at will and keep moving toward the choppers!
Shit! Strelok is down! But we still have to get out of here. Go!
Because of the emission. It's impossible to establish comms during one.
Yes.
Roger.
Major, where are you? We need to get Strelok to the evacuation point!
Major, we're going to have to keep moving.
Major, we can't wait for you much longer.
Okay, let's keep moving!
We're on the way!
Roger that! We'll be there soon!
Every zombie in Pripyat is going to know we're coming! We've got to move faster! Run!
Let's move to the right along the building! Double time!
Holy shit, you still here? Well, if you need anything, find me at the base. I am back and I have brought stalkers this time.
Our orders are to take off if we come under attack, so hurry the hell up!
We can't wait any longer! We're leaving in 60 seconds!
Major Degtyarev, we're ready to go!
Roger that!
To the choppers! Go, go, go!
Stingray! Where are you?
Major Degtyarev, we're taking heavy fire from an unidentified enemy! We cannot hold out for long!
Those... bastards again. Maybe we should go around the building.
Roger!
HQ on the line!
Major, do you read me?
[USS Command] Good. As of this moment you are responsible for completing operation Fairway. Kovalsky and the Stingray squad will assist you; Report.
[USS Command] Roger. Accept his offer. Do you know what caused our helicopters to crash?

[USS Command] Good. That means we have until the next emission. You'll be collected together with the stalker from position B28. Stingray squad will be evacuated with you, the birds are already in the air. Over and out.
Don't stop! Keep moving!
More zombies up ahead!
Run!
Well, that was fun!
Get up against the wall! These bastards are coming from all sides!
Take that!
You thought I'd be easy, huh?!
Have some of this!
You're the stalker who disabled the Scorcher?
I'll check.
I don't see anyone.
An emission is starting!
Thanks, I'll do that.
It's under ground.
We must inform the HQ of this as soon as possible.
Gotcha.
We've got a problem. Our choppers are crashing for reasons that we've not understood yet.
So that's what it is...
Ha-ha-ha! Wow, never heard that one before! A fridge, eh?
Also, Garry headed for Yanov station to restock. He asked me to tell you that he won't be back for a few days.
Also, Vano asked me to tell you that he and Garry headed for Yanov station. He said they'll bring back souvenirs.
Thanks for your help! By the way, the Colonel wants you to pay him a visit.
Yes, I have the coordinates, but the signal is intermitting and... it's moving!
The signal is back! Transmitting coordinates.
Is that really you? Well, I'll be...! We were starting to think we'd never see our doc again.
Okay...
Yes, sir!
The signal is gone.
It's back! It's right next to you.
It's close. And it's moving toward our base.
Colonel! A radio signal has been detected and its source is not far from the base. The transmission is encrypted, and I haven't been able to crack it yet.
What fridge? Where did you find it?
So what happened?
And what state would that be?
So? Tell me! Where were you?
We had a map with a safe air corridor between anomalies... And the helicopters had emission protection systems!
Until we work it out there won't be any helicopter support. The only way to get to the borders of the Zone is on foot.
Do you have the coordinates?
Major, Kovalsky here. You'd better get back here. We need to prepare for a possible attack. Bastards won't catch us with our pants down this time!
I'll contact my commanders right after the emission.

I spoke to the HQ commander and reported the situation to him along with all the information that's been collected. There won't be any helicopter support for a while; he suggested that we fortify your position and await further orders. USS observers are currently at the HQ, so you'll be able to talk to your superiors soon enough.
Lieutenant! Get'em on the line as soon as you can!
Come, let's talk inside!
Monolith again?!
Who are you?!
What?!
Hm... Not quite sure how to describe it.
Where did I find it...? I'd like to see you find anything in my state.
You're not going to believe me anyway, but... in a fridge.
Whew... it's a long story... I'll tell you another time.

That's odd... You're telling me you haven't noticed that anomalies move around after an emission? Some disappear, and new ones show up in different places, which makes your map of anomalies effectively useless.
The reasons are obvious. There are many anomalies in the air, especially in the center of the Zone.
Yes... but my plan didn't work. I came here to speak with your commanders. I have information that will allow the Army to take control of the Zone and destroy it.
Don't shoot, I'm headed to the main entrance!
Emissions don't just follow one another. If you can scan the area and identify all the anomalies the choppers will be able to collect us safely, provided they're dispatched right after an emission.
My name is Strelok.
Both targets eliminated. Well done! Mission accomplished. Fall back!
Look, there's another group! Let's see which one of them is the messenger.
Lieutenant Kirillov, Kovalsky here. I need you to escort the Major.
I'm guessing the one by the main entrance is their leader.
First target eliminated.
First target escaped. Fall back!
They're done! Time to take them down!
The targets are by the main entrance.
Major! The mercenaries are in position.
Second target eliminated.
Second target escaped. Fall back!
Both targets escaped. Abort mission and fall back!
Hey there!
What's up, man? How goes it?
Still alive? That's great.
How's it going?
What's up?
What's taking you so long, eh?
Come on already. Get over here.
What are you standing around for? Come on, get over here.
Get over here. We haven't got much time.
I said: come in! Don't stand there.
You can't go there!
Talk to the Barkeep.
Stop! I can't let you in here right now.
Get out of here, stalker.
Well? What do you want?
What is it again?
Will you ever just leave me alone? You all think I enjoy getting bothered like this, don't you?
Okay, bye.
So you're 1? Finally.
Finally, you leave me alone. It brings me happiness.
Hello, stalker. Thinking of placing an order?
What's up? Decided to order something?
Hey! You need something?
Don't worry. You'll get the goods a bit later.
Come back later. I don't have the goods yet.
Drop by later. I'll have your order by then.
That's your order complete. Collect your goods.
I have the goods. Take them!
Take your goods, stalker! As you can see, I keep my word.
The job's done. You can collect the goods.
See you, then.
Good luck.
Nice talking to you.
Farewell.
Good hunting, stalker.
Hello.
What's up?
Hey there.
Hey.
Hello. What brings you here?
Farewell, lad.
Don't forget the old man.
Wish you a straight road, boy.
Greetings, living soul.
What is it, young one? What are you looking for here?
Was it chance that brought you to this place, or what?
Greetings, young man!
I welcome you to our scientific base!
What do you bring to my humble laboratory?
Yes-yes?
Best wishes to you!
It's been nice meeting you.
Come back if you need anything else!
